application.doc: Retrieving a snippet of a statistics log file for a component

param.name: component_id
param.doc: The relative path of the statistics component.

param.name: file_id
param.doc: The relative path of the statistics log file.

param.name: size
param.doc: The number of lines to retrieve from the file. This parameter is optional and will be set to 100 if not specified. The maximum size that can be returned is 214800000 lines. If a size greater than that is specified, then the maximum (214800000 lines) is returned.

param.name: start
param.doc: The line number to start the snippet retrieval from. If specified the snippet will be retrieved counting forward from this line. This parameter is optional and if not specified the snippet will be retrieved counting back from the end of the file.

param.name: options
param.doc: Any options that are required for the snippet output. Accepted value is options=line_numbers, which include line numbers in the snippet output. This parameter is optional.

method.name: GET
method.id: Retrieving a snippet of a statistics log file
method.doc: To retrieve a snippet of a statistics log file for a component with the RESTful web service, issue an HTTP GET command on the Reverse Proxy statistics log files resource URI.

request.doc:
Retrieve the default snippet size from the tail of the log file
GET https://{appliance_hostname}/wga/reverseproxy/{instance_id}/statistics /{component_id}/stats_files/{file_id}
Retrieve the default snippet size with line numbers appended to the output
GET https://{appliance_hostname}/wga/reverseproxy/{instance_id}/statistics /{component_id}/stats_files/{file_id}?options=line-numbers
Retrieve the last 200 lines from the tail of the log file
GET https://{appliance_hostname}/wga/reverseproxy/{instance_id}/statistics /{component_id}/stats_files/{file_id}?size=200
Retrieve 200 lines that start from line number 1000 of the log file
GET https://{appliance_hostname}/wga/reverseproxy/{instance_id}/statistics /{component_id}/stats_files/{file_id}?size=200&start=1000

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

response.doc:
200 ok
{"contents":"The snippet of the log file"}

param.name: contents
param.doc: The snippet of the log file.

response.doc: There is a problem with the request. The JSON message describes the problem.
File not Found, The requested service does not exist. The JSON message indicates which resource.
An internal error occurred. The JSON message indicates the problem.
